segment.source: Restrict web content to display in the Managed Browser with Microsoft Intune - deleted
segment.target: Restrict web content to display in the Managed Browser with Microsoft Intune - deleted

segment.source: Restrict web content to display in the Managed Browser with Microsoft Intune - deleted
segment.target: Restrict web content to display in the Managed Browser with Microsoft Intune - deleted

segment.source: The managed browser is a web browsing application.
segment.target: The managed browser is a web browsing application.

segment.source: For devices that are not enrolled in Intune, you can restrict web content from policy-managed apps to only display in the Managed Browser app using the mobile app management policy.
segment.target: For devices that are not enrolled in Intune, you can restrict web content from policy-managed apps to only display in the Managed Browser app using the mobile app management policy.

segment.source: If you are using Intune to manage your devices, see the Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune topic to learn how to deploy a Managed Browser app.
segment.target: If you are using Intune to manage your devices, see the Manage Internet access using managed browser policies with Microsoft Intune topic to learn how to deploy a Managed Browser app.

segment.source: Create a policy with Managed Browser policy setting
segment.target: Create a policy with Managed Browser policy setting

segment.source: In the Azure portal, create an iOS or Android policy.
segment.target: In the Azure portal, create an iOS or Android policy.

segment.source: See the Create and deploy mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune for detailed instructions on how to create a policy.
segment.target: See the Create and deploy mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune for detailed instructions on how to create a policy.

segment.source: In the policy settings, set the Restrict web content to display in a corporate managed browser setting to Yes.
segment.target: In the policy settings, set the Restrict web content to display in a corporate managed browser setting to Yes.

segment.source: When this setting is set to Yes, it opens any web links from other policy-managed apps to open only in the Managed Browser app.
segment.target: When this setting is set to Yes, it opens any web links from other policy-managed apps to open only in the Managed Browser app.

segment.source: For devices that you are not managing, the end-user must install the Managed Browser app from the Apple store or Google Play to have the ability to open web links from policy-managed apps.
segment.target: For devices that you are not managing, the end-user must install the Managed Browser app from the Apple store or Google Play to have the ability to open web links from policy-managed apps.

segment.source: Create and deploy mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Create and deploy mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Configure data loss prevention app policies with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Configure data loss prevention app policies with Microsoft Intune
